results.title: Setting the scene
results.brief_description:
“Setting the scene”
was an ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, held 4 December 2008 - 19 April 2009.
See Exhibition activity record “Setting the Scene” (ID 37) for more information

Explore the sets of Baz Luhrmann’s Australia, plus over 300 works that reveal the inspired designs behind cinema classics including Metropolis, Mon Oncle, A Clockwork Orange, Cabaret, Alien and The Matrix.

Featuring original sketches, storyboards and models behind some of cinema’s most recognisable worlds, Setting the Scene explores how the spaces of the silver screen are constructed, and how production design shapes the narrative and mood of a film. The exhibition highlights the role and creative processes of production designers, art directors and film architects from Australia and abroad throughout the history of cinema.

results.title: Setting the pace
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Movietonenews and Tom Cummiskey
results.brief_description: In Kentucky blue grass country at Walnut Hall farm where harness racing blue bloods dates back to the turn of history, the young yearlings are raised until spring when it is time to train at Hanover farm. Harness racing is very popular with up to 40,000 spectators attending at Gosham park. This film tells the story from breeding the horse to the final goal of racing the horse.

results.title: Setting out, mortising, tenoning, band saw
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Woodworking machinery series”.
Shows and demonstrates the following: Job set out on rod; surfaces of members selected and marked for position of mortises; operation of mortising machine, first chisel and auger, then chain cutter; tenoning machine, explained and shown at work; cutters are shaped by grinding; the machine is set up and work carried out; the band saw is described and seen at work; the method of fitting a new saw is demonstrated; bevel cutting is shown.

results.title: Setting out
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Ben Lewin and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Surveys the chief events in Australian and world history that have influenced our migration patterns and immigration laws. Notes Aboriginal migration to Australia, the First Fleet, the discovery of gold, the land boom, drought and depression in the 1890s, Federation, World War I and after, the 1930s depression, post-war immigration, multiculturalism and Asian immigration. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Setting and fixing joinery
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
Shows method of setting and fixing joinery including bedding a stone sill; use of weather bar; temporary fixing of window frame frame; broken bond to accommodate frame when not brick size; fixing frames by metal tie, breeze brick and wood slip.

results.title: Sets: construction and display
results.creator_credit: Lawrie Lawler and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Studies television studio set design, concentrating on three common production situations: - the presenter set’, theinterview set’, and the `drama set’. Includes details of their design, planning and construction. Emphasises the need for co-ordination with studio engineers. Well presented and easy to understand with good use of models as an instructive tool.

results.title: Sets and numbers
results.brief_description: Uses animation to define the mathematical concept of sets and numbers. Introduces the concepts of order, cardinal number, empty set and equivalent set. Explains that consecutive numbers are just one larger than the preceding numeral.

results.title: Set no limits: Sydney 2000 Paralympic Games
results.brief_description: Australian Paralympians don’t often receive as much publicity as their non paralympic counterparts. This video attempts to even out the balance by providing highlights and victories from previous Paralympic Games, which began in 1960. Highlighted on the video is Lizzie (as in lizard), mascot of the Paralympic Games who symbolises the dreams and motivation of the competitors. This section is narrated by Olivia Newton-John. Suitable for primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Sestrieres 1949
results.creator_credit: Oxford University Film Society and Hugh Wyn Griffith
results.brief_description: This film is a photographic impression of a skiing holiday taken by 300 British students. No text and musical accompaniament acts as a narrative to the images we see. Great footage of skiers and Italian Alps. Music by Christofer Shaw and photography by Michael Warne, Charles Carson.
